Description.val:
The family of shoulder fired rockets provide lightweight, single shot, disposable weapons mainly employed against and optimized to defeat light armored vehicles and other hard targets at close combat ranges. They can be employed from an enclosure or the open battle field as assault weapons against bunkers, field fortifications, structures and other hard-point positions. Each shoulder fired rocket family has a training launcher and sub-caliber practice rocket that fully simulates firing.  This includes items such as:

The Tactical Rocket, 66mm, Light Anti-Armor Weapon (LAW); a lightweight, single shot, disposable weapon optimized to defeat light armored vehicles and other hard targets at close combat ranges.

The Tactical Rocket, 83mm, Shoulder Mounted Assault Weapon (SMAW) Rocket is designed especially for use against main battle tanks and other armored vehicles. There are four variants of the SMAW; High Explosive Dual Purpose, High Explosive Anti-Armor, Novel Explosive, and Common Practice (CP). The CP round is an unguided shoulder fired practice rocket designed to simulate firing a live rocket at hardened targets.

Justification.val: The funds in FY18 and out have been realigned to line item 1125.

Name.val: HA29 Rocket, 66MM HE M72A7 W/ GRAZE
